name: packages/oo7/index.js
packages/oo7/src/bond.js
Bond
description:
An object which tracks a single, potentially variable, value.
{@link Bond}s may be updated to new values with {@link Bond#changed} and reset to an indeterminate
("not ready") value with {@link Bond#reset}.

{@link Bond}s track their dependents - aspects of the program, including other {@link Bond}s,
which reference their current value. Dependents may be added with {@link Bond#use} and
removed with {@link Bond#drop}.

A {@link Bond} may be tied to a particular function to ensure it is called whenever
the value changes. This implies a dependency, and can be registered with {@link Bond#tie} and
dropped with {@link Bond#untie}. A function may also be called should the {@link Bond} be reverted
to an undefined value; in this case {@link Bond#notify} and {@link Bond#unnotify} should
be used.

{@link Bond}s can be made to execute a function once their value becomes ready
using {@link Bond#then}, which in some sense replicates the same function in the
context of a `Promise`. The similar function {@link Bond#done} is also supplied which
executes a given function when the {@link Bond} reaches a value which is considered
"final", determined by {@link Bond#isDone} being implemented and `true`. Precisely
what any given {@link Bond} considers final depends entirely on the subclass of
{@link Bond}; for the {@link Bond} class itself, `isDone` always returns `false` and thus
{@link Bond#done} is unusable. The value of the {@link Bond}, once _ready_, may
be logged to the console with the {@link Bond#log} function.

A {@link Bond} can provide a derivative {@link Bond} whose value reflects the "readiness"
of the original, using {@link Bond#ready} and conversely {@link Bond#notReady}. This
can also be queried normally with {@link Bond#isReady}.

One or a number of {@link Bond}s can be converted into a single {Promise} with the
{@link Bond#promise} function.

`Bonds` can be composed. {@link Bond#map} creates a new {@link Bond} whose value is a
transformation. {@link Bond.all} creates a new {@link Bond} which evaluates to the array
of values of each of a number of dependent {@link Bond}s. {@link Bond.mapAll} combines
both. {@link Bond#reduce} allows a {@link Bond} that evaluates to array to be
transformed into some other value recursively.

{@link Bond#sub} forms a derivative {@link Bond} as the subscript (square-bracket
indexing). {@link Bond#subscriptable} may be used to return a `Proxy` object that
allows the {@link Bond} to be subscripted (square-bracket indexed) directly without
need of the {@link Bond#sub} function.

{@link Bond} is built to be subclassed. When subclassing, three functions are
useful to implement. {@link Bond#isDone} may be implemented
in order to make {@link Bond#done} be useful. {@link Bond#initialise} is called exactly once
when there becomes at least one dependent; {@link Bond#finalise} is called when there
are no longer any dependents.

_WARNING_: You should not attempt to use the `toString` function with this
class. It cannot be meaningfully converted into a string, and to attempt it
will give an undefined result.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new {@link Bond} object whose value is _not ready_.

params.name: mayBeNull
params.description:
`true` if this instance's value may ever
validly be `null`. If `false`, then setting this object's value to `null`
is equivalent to reseting back to being _not ready_.

name: subscriptable
description:
Provides a transparently subscriptable version of this object.

The object that is returned from this function is a convenience `Proxy`
which acts exactly equivalent
to the original {@link Bond}, except that any subscripting of fields that are
not members of the {@link Bond} object will create a new {@link Bond} that
itself evaluates to this {@link Bond}'s value when subscripted with the same
field.

unknown.tagValue:
{Proxy} - `Proxy` object that acts as a subscriptable variation
for convenience.

params.name: depth
params.description:
The maximum number of levels of subscripting that
the returned `Proxy` will support.

return.description:
`Proxy` object that acts as a subscriptable variation
for convenience.

name: defaultTo
description:
Alters this object so that it is always _ready_.

If this object is ever {@link Bond#reset}, then it will be changed to the
value given.

params.name: x
params.description:
The value that this object represents if it would otherwise
be _not ready_.

return.description: {@link Bond} - This (mutated) object.

name: reset
description:
Resets the state of this Bond into being _not ready_.

Any functions that are registered for _notification_ (see {@link Bond#notify})
will be called if this {@link Bond} is currently _ready_.

name: changed
description:
Makes the object _ready_ and sets its current value.

Any functions that are registered for _notification_ (see {@link Bond#notify})
or are _tied_ (see {@link Bond#tie}) will be called if this {@link Bond} is not
currently _ready_ or is _ready_ but has a different value.

This function is a no-op if the JSON representations of `v` and of the
current value, if any, are equal.

params.name: v
params.description:
The new value that this object should represent. If `undefined`
then the function does nothing.

name: trigger
description:
Makes the object _ready_ and sets its current value.

Any functions that are registered for _notification_ (see {@link Bond#notify})
or are _tied_ (see {@link Bond#tie}) will be called if this {@link Bond} is not
currently _ready_ or is _ready_ but has a different value.

Unlike {@link Bond#changed}, this function doesn't check equivalence
between the new value and the current value.

params.name: v
params.description:
The new value that this object should represent. By default,
it will reissue the current value. It is an error to call it without
an argument if it is not _ready_.

name: use
description:
Register a single dependency for this object.

Notes that the object's value is in use, and that it should be computed.
{@link Bond} sub-classes are allowed to not work properly unless there is
at least one dependency registered.

name: drop
description:
Unregister a single dependency for this object.

Notes that a previously registered dependency has since expired. Must be
called exactly once for each time {@link Bond#use} was called.

name: initialise
description:
Initialise the object.

Will be called at most once before an accompanying {@link Bond#finalise}
and should initialise/open/create any resources that are required for the
sub-class to maintain its value.

name: finalise
description:
Uninitialise the object.

Will be called at most once after an accompanying {@link Bond#initialise}
and should close/finalise/drop any resources that are required for the
sub-class to maintain its value.

name: isDone
description:
Returns whether the object is currently in a terminal state.

_WARNING_: The output of this function should not change outside of a
value change. If it ever changes without the value changing, `trigger`
should be called to force an update.

unknown.tagValue:
{boolean} - `true` when the value should be interpreted as being
in a final state.

return.description:
`true` when the value should be interpreted as being
in a final state.

name: notify
description:
Register a function to be called when the value or the _readiness_
changes.

Calling this function already implies calling {@link Bond#use} - there
is no need to call both.

Use this only when you need to be notified should the object be reset to
a not _ready_ state. In general you will want to use {@link Bond#tie}
instead.

unknown.tagValue:
{Symbol} An identifier for this registration. Must be provided
to {@link Bond#unnotify} when the function no longer needs to be called.

params.name: f
params.description: The function to be called. Takes no parameters.

return.description:
An identifier for this registration. Must be provided
to {@link Bond#unnotify} when the function no longer needs to be called.

name: unnotify
description:
Unregister a function previously registered with {@link Bond#notify}.

Calling this function already implies calling {@link Bond#drop} - there
is no need to call both.

params.name: id
params.description:
The identifier returned from the corresponding
{@link Bond#notify} call.

name: tie
description:
Register a function to be called when the value changes.

Calling this function already implies calling {@link Bond#use} - there
is no need to call both.

Unlike {@link Bond#notify}, this does not get
called should the object become reset into being not _ready_.

unknown.tagValue:
{Symbol} - An identifier for this registration. Must be provided
to {@link Bond#untie} when the function no longer needs to be called.

params.name: f
params.description: The function to be called.

return.description:
An identifier for this registration. Must be provided
to {@link Bond#untie} when the function no longer needs to be called.

name: untie
description:
Unregister a function previously registered with {@link Bond#tie}.

Calling this function already implies calling {@link Bond#drop} - there
is no need to call both.

params.name: id
params.description:
The identifier returned from the corresponding
{@link Bond#tie} call.

name: isReady
description:
Determine if there is a definite value that this object represents at
present.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - `true` if there is presently a value that this object represents.

return.description: `true` if there is presently a value that this object represents.

name: latched
description:
Provide a derivative {@link Bond} which represents the same as this object
except that before it is ready it evaluates to a given default value and
after it becomes ready for the first time it stays fixed to that value
indefinitely.

unknown.tagValue:
{@link Bond} - Object representing the value returned by
this {@link Bond} except that it evaluates to the given default value when
this bond is not ready and sticks to the first value that made it ready.

params.name: defaultValue
params.description:
The value that the new bond should take when
this bond is not ready.

return.description:
{@link Bond} - Object representing the value returned by
this {@link Bond} except that it evaluates to the given default value when
this bond is not ready and sticks to the first value that made it ready.

name: default
description:
Provide a {@link Bond} which represents the same as this object except that
it takes a particular value when this would be unready.

unknown.tagValue:
{@link Bond} - Object representing the value returned by
this {@link Bond} except that it evaluates to the given default value when
this bond is not ready. The returned object itself is always _ready_.

params.name: defaultValue
params.description:
The value that the new bond should take when
this bond is not ready.

return.description:
{@link Bond} - Object representing the value returned by
this {@link Bond} except that it evaluates to the given default value when
this bond is not ready. The returned object itself is always _ready_.

name: ready
description:
Provide a {@link Bond} which represents whether this object itself represents
a particular value.

unknown.tagValue:
{@link Bond} - Object representing the value returned by
this {@link Bond}'s {@link Bond#isReady} result. The returned object is
itself always _ready_.

return.description:
{@link Bond} - Object representing the value returned by
this {@link Bond}'s {@link Bond#isReady} result. The returned object is
itself always _ready_.

name: notReady
description: Convenience function for the logical negation of {@link Bond#ready}.

unknown.tagValue:
{@link Bond} Object representing the logical opposite
of the value returned by
this {@link Bond}'s {@link Bond#isReady} result. The returned object is
itself always _ready_.

return.description:
{@link Bond} Object representing the logical opposite
of the value returned by
this {@link Bond}'s {@link Bond#isReady} result. The returned object is
itself always _ready_.

name: then
description:
Register a function to be called when this object becomes _ready_.

For an object to be considered _ready_, it must represent a definite
value. In this case, {@link Bond#isReady} will return `true`.

If the object is already _ready_, then `f` will be called immediately. If
not, `f` will be deferred until the object assumes a value. `f` will be
called at most once.

params.name: f
params.description: The callback to be made once the object is ready.

name: done
description:
Register a function to be called when this object becomes _done_.

For an object to be considered `done`, it must be _ready_ and the
function {@link Bond#isDone} should exist and return `true`.

If the object is already _done_, then `f` will be called immediately. If
not, `f` will be deferred until the object assumes a value. `f` will be
called at most once.

params.name: f
params.description: The callback to be made once the object is ready.

name: log
description: Logs the current value to the console.

return.description: {@link Bond} The current object.

name: mapToString
description: Maps the represented value to a string.

unknown.tagValue:
{@link Bond} A new {link Bond} which represents the `toString`
function on whatever value this {@link Bond} represents.

return.description:
{@link Bond} A new {link Bond} which represents the `toString`
function on whatever value this {@link Bond} represents.

name: map
description: Make a new {@link Bond} which is the functional transformation of this object.

unknown.tagValue:
{@link Bond} - An object representing this object's value with
the function `transform` applied to it.

params.name: transform
params.description:
The transformation to apply to the value represented
by this {@link Bond}.

params.name: outResolveDepth
params.description:
The number of levels deep in any array
object values of the result of the transformation that {@link Bond} values
will be resolved.

params.name: cache
params.description: Cache information. See constructor.

params.name: latched
params.description: Should the value be latched so that once ready it stays ready?

params.name: mayBeNull
params.description:
Should the value be allowed to be `null` such that if it ever becomes
null, it is treated as being unready?

return.description:
{@link Bond} - An object representing this object's value with
the function `transform` applied to it.

name: xform
description: Just like `map`, except that it defaults to no latching and mayBeNull.

unknown.tagValue:
{@link Bond} - An object representing this object's value with
the function `transform` applied to it.

params.name: transform
params.description:
The transformation to apply to the value represented
by this {@link Bond}.

params.name: outResolveDepth
params.description:
The number of levels deep in any array
object values of the result of the transformation that {@link Bond} values
will be resolved.

params.name: cache
params.description: Cache information. See constructor.

params.name: latched
params.description: Should the value be latched so that once ready it stays ready?

params.name: mayBeNull
params.description:
Should the value be allowed to be `null` such that if it ever becomes
null, it is treated as being unready?

return.description:
{@link Bond} - An object representing this object's value with
the function `transform` applied to it.

name: mapEach
description:
Create a new {@link Bond} which represents this object's array value with
its elements transformed by a function.

unknown.tagValue:
The new {@link Bond} object representing the element-wise
Transformation.

params.name: transform
params.description: The transformation to apply to each element.

return.description:
The new {@link Bond} object representing the element-wise
Transformation.

name: sub
description:
Create a new {@link Bond} which represents this object's value when
subscripted.

unknown.tagValue:
{@link Bond} - The object representing the value which is the
value represented by this object subscripted by the value represented by
`name`.

params.name: name
params.description:
The field or index by which to subscript this object's
represented value. May itself be a {@link Bond}, in which case, the
resolved value is used.

params.name: outResolveDepth
params.description:
The depth in any returned structure
that a {@link Bond} may be for it to be resolved.

return.description:
{@link Bond} - The object representing the value which is the
value represented by this object subscripted by the value represented by
`name`.

name: all
description:
Create a new {@link Bond} which represents the array of many objects'
representative values.

This object will be _ready_ if and only if all objects in `list` are
themselves _ready_.

unknown.tagValue:
{@link Bond} - The object representing the value of the array of
each object's representative value in `list`.

params.name: list
params.description:
An array of {@link Bond} objects, plain values or
structures (arrays/objects) which contain either of these.

params.name: resolveDepth
params.description:
The depth in a structure (array or object)
that a {@link Bond} may be in any of `list`'s items for it to be resolved.

return.description:
{@link Bond} - The object representing the value of the array of
each object's representative value in `list`.

name: mapAll
description:
Create a new {@link Bond} which represents a functional transformation of
many objects' representative values.

params.name: list
params.description: An array of {@link Bond} objects or plain values.

params.name: f
resolveDepth
params.description:
The depth in a structure (array or object)
that a {@link Bond} may be in any of `list`'s items for it to be resolved.

params.name: outResolveDepth
params.description:
The depth in any returned structure
that a {@link Bond} may be for it to be resolved.

name: reduce
description:
Lazily transforms the contents of this object's value when it is an array.

This operates on a {@link Bond} which should represent an array. It
transforms this into a value based on a number of elements at the
beginning of that array using a recursive _reduce_ algorithm.

The reduce algorithm works around an accumulator model. It begins with
the `init` value, and incremenetally accumulates
elements from the array by changing its value to one returned from the
`accum` function, when passed the current accumulator and the next value
from the array. The `accum` function may return a {@link Bond}, in which case it
will be resolved (using {@link Bond#then}) and that value used.

The `accum` function returns a value (or a {@link Bond} which resolves to a value)
of an array with exactly two elements; the first is the new value for the
accumulator. The second is a boolean _early exit_ flag.

Accumulation will continue until either there are no more elements in the
array to be processed, or until the _early exit_ flag is true, which ever
happens first.

unknown.tagValue:
{Bond} - A {@link Bond} representing `init` when the input array is empty,
otherwise the reduction of that array.

params.name: accum
params.description: The reduce's accumulator function.

params.name: init
params.description: The initialisation value for the reduce algorithm.

return.description:
A {@link Bond} representing `init` when the input array is empty,
otherwise the reduction of that array.

name: promise
description: Create a Promise which represents one or more {@link Bond}s.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} - A object which resolves to an array of values
corresponding to those passed in `list`.

params.name: list
params.description: A list of values, {Promise}s or {@link Bond}s.

return.description:
A object which resolves to an array of values
corresponding to those passed in `list`.

name: instanceOf
description:
Duck-typed alternative to `instanceof Bond`, when multiple instantiations
of `Bond` may be available.

name: packages/oo7/src/bondCache.js
packages/oo7/src/bondProxy.js
packages/oo7/src/defaultBond.js
DefaultBond
description:
Derivative {@link Bond} representing the another {@link Bond} except defaulting
to same given `default` when not ready.

name: packages/oo7/src/index.js
packages/oo7/src/latchBond.js
LatchBond
description:
Derivative {@link Bond} resolving to a default value when not ready.
Once inputBond is ready, its value remains fixed indefinitely.

name: packages/oo7/src/notReadyBond.js
NotReadyBond
description: Derivative {@link Bond} representing the non-readiness of another {@link Bond}.

name: packages/oo7/src/reactiveBond.js

unknown.tagValue: A {@link Bond} which retains dependencies on other {@link Bond}s.

This inherits from the {@link Bond} class, providing its full API,
but also allows for dependencies to other `Bond`s to be registered. When
any dependency changes value (or _readiness_), a callback is executed and
is passed the new set of underlying values corresponding to each dependency.

The callback is made if and only if this object is in use (i.e. {@link Bond#use}
or one of its dependents has been called).

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new object.

params.name: args
params.description:
Each item that this object's representative value
is dependent upon, and which needs to be used by the callback function
(presumably to determine that value to be passed into {@link Bond#changed}).

params.name: dependencies
params.description:
{@link Bond}s or {Promise}s that the representative
value is dependent on, but which are not needed for passing into the
callback.

params.name: execute
params.description:
The callback function which is called when
any item of `args` or `deps` changes its underlying value. A value corresponding
to each item in `args` are passed to the callback:
items that are {@link Bond}s are resolved to the value they represent before
being passed into the callback `execute` function. {Promise} objects are
likewise resolved for their underlying value. Structures such as arrays
and objects are traversed recursively and likewise interpreted. Other
types are passed straight through.
The callback is only made when all items of `args` are considered _ready_.

params.name: mayBeNull
params.description:
Noramlly, `null` is a valid value for dependent `Bond`s
and `Promise`s to represent. Pass `false` here to disallow `null` to be
considered valid (and thus any `null` dependencies in `args` will mean that
dependency is considered not _ready_ and no callback will happen).

params.name: resolveDepth
params.description:
The maximum number of times to recurse into
arrays or objects of `args` items in searching for {@link Bond}s or {Promise}s
to resolve.

name: packages/oo7/src/reactivePromise.js
packages/oo7/src/readyBond.js
ReadyBond
description: Derivative {@link Bond} representing the readiness of another {@link Bond}.

name: packages/oo7/src/timeBond.js
TimeBond

unknown.tagValue:
{@link Bond} object which represents the current time rounded down
to the second.

name: packages/oo7/src/transformBond.js

unknown.tagValue:
Configurable {@link Bond}-derivation representing a functional transformation
of a number of other items.

This is the underlying class which powers the {@link Bond#map} and {@link Bond#mapAll}
functions; you'll generally want to use those unless there is some particular
aspect of this class's configurability that you need.

It is constructed with a transform function and a number of args; this
{@link Bond} represents the result of the function when applied to those arguemnts'
representative values. `Bond`s and `Promises`, are resolved automatically at
a configurable depth within complex structures, both as input items and
the value resulting from the transform function.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new object.

params.name: transform
params.description:
The transformation function. It is called with
values corresponding (in order) to the items of `args`. It may return a
{@link Bond}, {Promise} or plain value resolving to representative values.

params.name: args
params.description:
A list of items whose representative values should be
passed to `transform`.

params.name: dependencies
params.description:
A list of {@link Bond}s on which `transform` indirectly
depends.

params.name: outResolveDepth
params.description:
The depth in any returned structure
that a {@link Bond} may be for it to be resolved.

params.name: resolveDepth
params.description:
The depth in a structure (array or object)
that a {@link Bond} may be in any of `args`'s items for it to be resolved
(in place) to its representative value. Beyond this depth, {@link Bond}s amd
{Promise}s will be left alone.

params.name: latched
params.description:
If `false`, this object becomes _not ready_ as
long as there is an output value waiting for resolution.

params.name: mayBeNull
params.description:
If `false`, a resultant value of `null` from
`transform` causes this {@link Bond} to become _not ready_. Optional.

params.name: context
params.description:
The context (i.e. `this` object) that `transform`
is bound to. Optional; defaults to the value set by {@link setDefaultTransformBondContext}.

name: setDefaultContext
description: Set the default context under which {@link Bond} transformations run.

name: packages/oo7-parity/src/abis/index.js
abiPolyfill
description: Deprecated.

name: GitHubHintABI
description: Github Hint ABI definition.

name: packages/oo7-parity/src/index.js
constructor
description:
Creates a new oo7-parity bonds aggregate object with given ethereum provider.

Additional documentation can be found at https://wiki.parity.io/oo7-Parity-Reference.html

params.name: provider
params.description: Web3-compatible transport Provider (i.e. `window.ethereum`). Uses a sane default if not provided.

name: time
description: A {@link Bond} representing latest time. Updated every second.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.time
.tie(console.log) // prints time periodically

name: height
description:
A {@link Bond} representing latest block number.
Alias for {@link Bonds.blockNumber}

name: blockNumber
description: A {@link Bond} representing latest block number.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.blockNumber
.tie(console.log) // prints latest block number when it changes

name: blockByNumber
description: A function returning bond that represents given block content.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.blockByNumber(bonds.height)
.tie(console.log) // prints latest block

params.name: number
params.description: block number

return.description: block bond

name: blockByHash
description: A function returning bond that represents given block content.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.blockByHash('0x2b23d04567313fa141ca396f1e2620b62ab0c5d69f8c77157118f8d7671e1f4d')
.tie(console.log) // prints block with given hash

params.name: hash
params.description: block hash

return.description: block bond

name: findBlock
description:
Similar to {@link Bonds.blockByNumber} and {@link Bonds.blockByHash},
but accepts both hashes and numbers as arguments.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.findBlock('0x2b23d04567313fa141ca396f1e2620b62ab0c5d69f8c77157118f8d7671e1f4d')
.tie(console.log) // prints block with given hash

params.name: hashOrNumber
params.description: block hash or block number

return.description: block bond

name: blocks
description:
A subscriptable version of {@link Bonds.findBlock}

You can retrieve bonds given block numbers or hashes or other Bonds.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.blocks['0x2b23d04567313fa141ca396f1e2620b62ab0c5d69f8c77157118f8d7671e1f4d']
.tie(console.log) // prints block with given hash

bonds
.blocks[bonds.height]
.tie(console.log) // prints latest block every time it changes

name: head
description: A {@link Bond} for latest block.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.head
.tie(console.log) // prints latest block every time it changes

name: author
description:
A {@link Bond} for currently set block author.
Represents a result of `eth_coinbase` RPC call.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.author
.tie(console.log) // prints currently set block author (coinbase/miner) every time it changes

name: accounts
description: List of accounts managed by the node.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.accounts
.tie(console.log) // prints accounts list every time it changes

name: defaultAccount
description: User-selected default account for this dapp.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.defaultAccount
.tie(console.log) // prints default account every time it changes

name: me
description: Alias for {@link Bonds.defaultAccount}
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.me
.tie(console.log) // prints default account every time it changes

name: post
description: Posts a transaction to the network.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.post({ to: bonds.me, value: 0  })
.tie(console.log) // Reports transaction progress

params.name: tx
params.description: Transaction details

name: sign
description: Returns a signature of given message
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.sign('0x2ea2e504d09c458dbadc703112125564d53ca03c27a5b28e7b3e2b5804289c45')
.tie(console.log) // Reports signing progress

params.name: hash
params.description: Hash to sign

params.name: from
params.description: Optional account that should be used for signing.

name: balance
description: Returns balance of given address.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.balance(bonds.me)
.tie(console.log) // prints default account balance every time any of them changes

name: code
description: Returns code of given address.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.code(bonds.me)
.tie(console.log) // prints default account code every time any of them changes

name: nonce
description: Returns the nonce of given address.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.nonce(bonds.me)
.tie(console.log) // prints default account nonce every time any of them changes

name: storageAt
description: Returns storage at given index of an address.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.storageAt(bonds.me, 0)
.tie(console.log) // prints default account storage at position 0 every time any of them changes

params.name: address
params.description: Contract address

params.name: storageIdx
params.description: Contract storage index

name: syncing
description:
Returns node's syncing status.
If the node is fully synced this will return `false`.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.syncing
.tie(console.log) // prints sync status every time it changes

name: authoring
description:
Returns node's authoring status.
If the node is not authoring blocks this will return `false`.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.authoring
.tie(console.log) // prints authoring status every time it changes

name: hashrate
description:
Reported hashrate.
If there is an external miner connected to the node it will return reported values.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.hashrate
.tie(console.log) // prints current average hashrate

name: gasPrice
description:
Suggested gas price value. (Gas Price Oracle)
This returns a suggested gas price for next transaction. The estimation is based on statistics from last blocks.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.gasPrice
.tie(console.log) // prints current gas price suggestion

name: estimateGas
description: Estimates gas required to execute given transaction
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.estimateGas({ from: bonds.me, to: '0x00D6Cc1BA9cf89BD2e58009741f4F7325BAdc0ED' })
.tie(console.log) // prints current gas estimate

params.name: call
params.description: Transaction request

return.description: gas estimate

name: blockTransactionCount
description: Returns block transaction count given block number or hash.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.blockTransactionCount(bonds.blockNumber)
.tie(console.log) // prints number of transactions in latest block

params.name: block
params.description: block number or hash

return.description: number of transactions in block

name: uncleCount
description: Returns uncle count given block number or hash.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.uncleCount(bonds.blockNumber)
.tie(console.log) // prints number of uncles in latest block

unknown.tagValue: {Bond.<Number>} number of uncles in a block

params.name: block
params.description: block number or hash

return.description: number of uncles in a block

name: uncle
description: Returns uncle given block number or hash and uncle index
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.uncle(bonds.blockNumber, 0)
.tie(console.log) // prints the first uncle in latest block

params.name: block
params.description: block number or hash

params.name: index
params.description: index of an uncle within a block

return.description: uncle header at that index

name: transaction
description: Returns transaction given block number or hash and transaction index
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.transaction(bonds.blockNumber, 0)
.tie(console.log) // prints the first uncle in latest block

params.name: block
params.description: block number or hash

params.name: index
params.description: index of a transaction within a block

return.description: transaction at that index

name: receipt
description: Returns receipt given transaction hash.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.receipt(bonds.transaction(bonds.height, 0).map(x => x ? x.hash : undefined))
.tie(console.log) // prints receipt of first transaction in latest block

params.name: hash
params.description: transaction hash

return.description: transaction at that index

name: clientVersion
description: Returns client version string. (`web3_clientVersion`).
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.clientVersion
.tie(console.log)

name: peerCount
description: Returns current peer count. (`net_peerCount`).
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.peerCount
.tie(console.log)

name: listening
description: Returns true if the node is actively listening for network connections.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.listening
.tie(console.log)

name: chainId
description:
Returns chain id (used for chain replay protection).
NOTE: It's _not_ network id.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.chainId
.tie(console.log)

name: hashContent
description: Returns a hash of content under given URL.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.hashContent('https://google.com')
.tie(console.log)

params.name: url
params.description: URL of the content

return.description: hash of the content

name: chainName
description: Returns a string name of currently connected chain.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.chainName
.tie(console.log)

name: chainStatus
description: Returns a status of currently connected chain.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.chainStatus
.tie(console.log)

name: replayTx
description: Replays (re-executes) a transaction. Returns requested traces of execution.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.replayTx('0x2ea2e504d09c458dbadc703112125564d53ca03c27a5b28e7b3e2b5804289c45', ['trace'])
.tie(console.log)

params.name: hash
params.description: Transaction hash

params.name: traces
params.description: Any subset of `trace`,`vmTrace`,`stateDiff`.

name: callTx
description: Executs a transaction and collects traces.

params.name: transaction
params.description: Transaction request

params.name: traces
params.description: Any subset of `trace`,`vmTrace`,`stateDiff`.

params.name: block
params.description: Block number or hash

name: deployContract
description: Deploys a new contract
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.deployContract('0x1234', abi, {})
.tie(console.log) // Reports deployment progress

params.name: init
params.description: Initialization bytecode

params.name: abi
params.description: Contract ABI

params.name: options
params.description: Deployment options

name: makeContract
description: Creates bond-enabled contract object for existing contract.
examples:
const { bonds } = require('oo7-parity')

bonds
.makeContract(bonds.me, abi)
.someMethod()
.tie(console.log) // returns a result of someMethod call

params.name: address
params.description: Contract address

params.name: abi
params.description: Contract ABI

params.name: extras
params.description: Additional methods not defined in the ABI.

name: registry
description: Parity registry contract instance.

name: githubhint
description: Parity registry contract instance.

name: operations
description: Parity registry contract instance.

name: badgereg
description: Parity registry contract instance.

name: tokenreg
description: Parity registry contract instance.

name: badges
description: A {@link Bond} representing all currently registered badges from BadgeReg.

name: badgesOf
description: Returns a list of badges for given address.

return.description: see {@link Bonds.badges}

name: tokens
description: A {@link Bond} representing all currently registered tokens from TokenReg.

name: tokensOf
description: Returns a list of tokens with a non-empty balance for given address.

return.description: see {@link Bonds.tokens}

params.name: Options
params.description: object

name: packages/oo7-parity/src/utils/index.js
capitalizeFirstLetter
description: Capitalizes the first letter of a string

name: singleton
description:
Wrap `f` in a function that ensures it's called at most once.
The value returned from `f` is memoized and returned for all subsequent calls.

name: denominationMultiplier
description: Returns a {@link BigNumber} multiplier for give string denominator

params.name: denominator
params.description: denominator (wei, eth, finney, Gwei, etc)

return.description: multiplier

name: defDenom
description: Add missing denominator to the value

params.name: v
params.description: value

params.name: d
params.description: denominator

name: formatValue
description: Formats a value with denominator

params.name: n
params.description: value with denominator

name: formatValueNoDenom
description: Format value without denominator

name: formatToExponential
description: Format value without denominator

params.name: {number|
params.description: exponent

name: splitValue
description: Split value into base and denominator

name: formatBalance
description: Display balance into human-readable format with denomnator

name: formatBlockNumber
description: Format block number into human-readable representation.
